 Context: Ingredients: 3 bone-in chicken breast halves, skinless, 1 (14.5 ounce) can chicken broth, 3 potatoes, 1 yellow onion, 3 stalks celery, 2 tablespoons vegetable oil, 2 tablespoons all-purpose flour, 2 cups frozen mixed vegetables, 1 to taste salt and pepper to taste, 1/4 teaspoon garlic powder, 1 (9 inch) frozen prepared pie crust, thawed, 
Directions: 0) Wash chicken breasts in water and then place in a pot with water just to cover the chicken. 1) Add some salt and pepper and garlic powder. 2) Let cool in the pot. 3) Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). 4) Wash and cut potatoes into bite size pieces and boil till almost fork tender. 5) Drain and set aside. 6) Wash celery and cut to bite-size pieces. 7) Cut onion to bite-size pieces. 8) In a large heavy skillet, over medium heat, saute celery and onion with 2 tablespoons oil, for 5 to 8 minutes. 9) Add the frozen vegetables and cook another 5 minutes. 10) Add flour and cook about 30 seconds. 11) Add chicken broth and bring to a boil. 12) After it has become thick, add potatoes. 13) Remove chicken from pot and cut into bite-size pieces and add to vegetable mixture. 14) Add salt and pepper to taste. 15) Pour mixture into a 9 inch deep dish pie plate and cover with pie shell. 16) Make sure you crimp the edges of the pie shell to the plate so no juices spill in oven. 17) Bake at 350  degrees F (175 degrees C) for 45 minutes or until pie shell is cooked and golden brown.

 Context: Ingredients: 3 bone-in chicken breast halves, skinless, 1 (14.5 ounce) can chicken broth, 3 potatoes, 1 yellow onion, 3 stalks celery, 2 tablespoons vegetable oil, 2 tablespoons all-purpose flour, 2 cups frozen mixed vegetables, 1 to taste salt and pepper to taste, 1/4 teaspoon garlic powder, 1 (9 inch) frozen prepared pie crust, thawed, 
Directions: 0) Wash chicken breasts in water and then place in a pot with water just to cover the chicken. 1) Add some salt and pepper and garlic powder. 2) Let cool in the pot. 3) Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). 4) Wash and cut potatoes into bite size pieces and boil till almost fork tender. 5) Drain and set aside. 6) Wash celery and cut to bite-size pieces. 7) Cut onion to bite-size pieces. 8) In a large heavy skillet, over medium heat, saute celery and onion with 2 tablespoons oil, for 5 to 8 minutes. 9) Add the frozen vegetables and cook another 5 minutes. 10) Add flour and cook about 30 seconds. 11) Add chicken broth and bring to a boil. 12) After it has become thick, add potatoes. 13) Remove chicken from pot and cut into bite-size pieces and add to vegetable mixture. 14) Add salt and pepper to taste. 15) Pour mixture into a 9 inch deep dish pie plate and cover with pie shell. 16) Make sure you crimp the edges of the pie shell to the plate so no juices spill in oven. 17) Bake at 350  degrees F (175 degrees C) for 45 minutes or until pie shell is cooked and golden brown.
conv_answer: Now add some salt and 1/4 teaspoon of garlic powder.
target_answer: 1) Add some salt and pepper and garlic powder.

Question: Hello. I'm all set to make the gingerbread men, tell me what to do! 
 Context: Ingredients: 1/2 cup margarine, 1/2 cup sugar, 1/2 cup molasses, 1 egg yolk, 2 cups sifted all-purpose flour, 1/2 teaspoon salt, 1/2 teaspoon baking powder, 1/2 teaspoon baking soda, 1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon, 1 teaspoon ground cloves, 1 teaspoon ginger, 1/2 teaspoon ground nutmeg, 
Directions: 0) In a large bowl, cream together the margarine and sugar until smooth. 1) Stir in molasses and egg yolk. 2) Combine the flour, salt, baking powder, baking soda, cinnamon, cloves, ginger, and nutmeg; blend into the molasses mixture until smooth. 3) Cover, and chill for at least one hour. 4) Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). 5) On a lightly floured surface, roll the dough out to 1/4 inch thickness. 6) Cut into desired shapes with cookie cutters. 7) Place cookies 2 inches apart on ungreased cookie sheets. 8) Bake for 8 to 10 minutes in the preheated oven, until firm. 9) Remove from cookie sheets to cool on wire racks. 10) Frost or decorate when cool.
conv_answer: First, take a large bowl.

 Context: Ingredients: 1/2 cup margarine, 1/2 cup sugar, 1/2 cup molasses, 1 egg yolk, 2 cups sifted all-purpose flour, 1/2 teaspoon salt, 1/2 teaspoon baking powder, 1/2 teaspoon baking soda, 1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon, 1 teaspoon ground cloves, 1 teaspoon ginger, 1/2 teaspoon ground nutmeg, 
Directions: 0) In a large bowl, cream together the margarine and sugar until smooth. 1) Stir in molasses and egg yolk. 2) Combine the flour, salt, baking powder, baking soda, cinnamon, cloves, ginger, and nutmeg; blend into the molasses mixture until smooth. 3) Cover, and chill for at least one hour. 4) Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). 5) On a lightly floured surface, roll the dough out to 1/4 inch thickness. 6) Cut into desired shapes with cookie cutters. 7) Place cookies 2 inches apart on ungreased cookie sheets. 8) Bake for 8 to 10 minutes in the preheated oven, until firm. 9) Remove from cookie sheets to cool on wire racks. 10) Frost or decorate when cool.

Question: Ok good should we start? 
 Context: Ingredients: 1 pound skinless, boneless chicken breast halves, cut into bite size pieces, 1 cup lemonade, 2 tablespoons olive oil, 1 tablespoon lime juice, 1 1/2 teaspoons Worcestershire sauce, 1/2 teaspoon garlic powder, 1/2 teaspoon onion powder, 1 bay leaf, 1 (12 ounce) package corn tortillas, 1 head lettuce, shredded, 2 large tomatoes, chopped, 1 (8 ounce) package shredded sharp Cheddar cheese, 1 (8 ounce) jar salsa, 1 (8 ounce) container sour cream, 
Directions: 0) In a large skillet over medium heat, combine chicken, lemonade, olive oil, lime juice, and Worcestershire sauce. 1) Season with garlic powder, onion powder, and bay leaf. 2) Simmer until chicken is no longer pink, and juices run clear, 15 to 20 minutes. 3) Meanwhile, warm the tortillas in the oven or microwave until soft. 4) When chicken is fully cooked, transfer to serving bowl. 5) Place lettuce, tomatoes, cheese, salsa, and sour cream in serving dishes. 6) Each person can create their own wrap, using their preferred ingredients.

Question: Hi. what is the first step to bake basil burgers? 
 Context: Ingredients: 1 1/4 pounds ground beef, 3 tablespoons Worcestershire sauce, 1 1/2 tablespoons dried basil, or to taste, 1/4 teaspoon garlic salt, 1/4 teaspoon ground black pepper, 4 hamburger buns, split, 
Directions: 0) Preheat an outdoor grill for high heat. 1) In a bowl, mix the ground beef, Worcestershire sauce, basil, garlic salt, and pepper. 2) Form the mixture into 4 burger patties. 3) Lightly oil the grill grate, and cook burgers about 6 minutes, turning once, to an internal temperature of 160 degrees F (70 degrees C), or to desired doneness. 4) Serve on hamburger buns.

Question: Alright, I will take my Italian porcini. How should I start to prepare the food?

Question: Ok. I have creamed it together. What is next? 
 Context: Ingredients: 1 cup unsalted butter, 1 cup chai tea mix, 1 1/3 cups white sugar, 2 eggs, 3 1/2 cups all-purpose flour, 1 tablespoon baking powder, 2 teaspoons salt, 1/2 cup white sugar for decoration, 
Directions: 0) In a large bowl, cream together the butter, 1 1/3 cups sugar, and chai tea mix until light and fluffy. 1) Beat in the eggs one at a time, mixing well after each. 2) Combine the flour, baking powder, and salt; blend into the creamed mixture until all of the dry has been absorbed. 3) Cover the dough, and refrigerate for 1 hour. 4) Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). 5) Roll the cookie dough into walnut sized balls, and roll the balls in sugar. 6) Place the cookies onto greased cookie sheets about 3 inches apart, and flatten slightly using the tines of a fork. 7) Bake for 10 to 12 minutes in the preheated oven, just until the edges begin to brown. 8) Remove from cookie sheets to cool on wire racks.

Question: Hi. how do I make the bakers secret pie crust? 
 Context: Ingredients: 3/4 cup cake flour, 3/4 cup all-purpose flour, 1 teaspoon white sugar, 1/2 teaspoon salt, 1/8 teaspoon baking powder, 4 tablespoons unsalted butter, 5 tablespoons shortening, 1 egg yolk, 2 teaspoons distilled white vinegar, 3 cubes  ice, 1/2 cup cold water, 
Directions: 0) Measure butter and shortening onto a plate, put into freezer for about 20 minutes. 1) Measure cake flour, all-purpose flour, sugar, salt and baking powder into the bowl of a food processor. 2) Pulse for a few seconds to mix. 3) Take 1/2 of the cold butter and 1/2 of the cold shortening, put into processor with dry ingredients and pulse off and on for about 1 minute. 4) Scrape down twice while doing this. 5) Take remainder of the cold butter and cold shortening and cut in very briefly with the processor, leaving visible pea-sized chunks. 6) In a measuring cup, mix egg yolk and vinegar together, add ice cubes and water. 7) Let this get chilled, about 3 to 4 minutes. 8) Remove mixed flours and shortening from processor, put into a large mixing bowl. 9) Sprinkle approximately 4 to 5 tablespoons of this egg, water, vinegar mixture, a little at a time, mixing gently with a fork. 10) The key to this is, you do not want a wet dough, and you do not want to overmix. 11) Place this dough into plastic wrap or plastic bag, chill in refrigerator for a few minutes. 12) Remove from refrigerator and roll out.
conv_answer: Hi. take 4 tablespoons unsalted butter and 5 tablespoons shortening. Place them into the freezer for 20 minutes.
target_answer: 0) Measure butter and shortening onto a plate, put into freezer for about 20 minutes.

predictions: 10) The key to this is, you do not want a wet dough, and you do not want to overmix.

Directions: 0) Measure butter and shortening onto a plate, put into freezer for about 20 minutes. 1) Measure cake flour, all-purpose flour, sugar, salt and baking powder into the bowl of a food processor. 2) Pulse for a few seconds to mix. 3) Take 1/2 of the cold butter and 1/2 of the cold shortening, put into processor with dry ingredients and pulse off and on for about 1 minute. 4) Scrape down twice while doing this. 5) Take remainder of the cold butter and cold shortening and cut in very briefly with the processor, leaving visible pea-sized chunks. 6) In a measuring cup, mix egg yolk and vinegar together, add ice cubes and water. 7) Let this get chilled, about 3 to 4 minutes. 8) Remove mixed flours and shortening from processor, put into a large mixing bowl. 9) Sprinkle approximately 4 to 5 tablespoons of this egg, water, vinegar mixture, a little at a time, mixing gently with a fork. 10) The key to this is, you do not want a wet dough, and you do not want to overmix. 11) Place this dough into plastic wrap or plastic bag, chill in refrigerator for a few minutes. 12) Remove from refrigerator and roll out.
conv_answer: During the one minute of mixing you should stop twice and scrape down the edges of the bowl.

Question: Alright, what is the first step? 
 Context: Ingredients: 16 cups popped popcorn, 1 cup roasted peanuts, 1 cup brown sugar, 1/2 cup butter, 1/4 cup light corn syrup, 1 teaspoon vanilla extract, 1 teaspoon salt, 1/2 teaspoon baking soda, 1 cup milk chocolate chips, 1 teaspoon shortening, 
Directions: 0) Grease cookie sheets. 1) Place popcorn and peanuts in a paper bag. 2) Set aside. 3) In a microwave safe bowl, combine sugar, butter, corn syrup, vanilla and salt. 4) Microwave 4 minutes, until bubbly. 5) Stir in baking soda. 6) Pour over popcorn mixture and shake bag to coat. 7) Roll down edges of bag and place bag in microwave. 8) Heat for 2 minutes, shaking three times to mix. 9) Spread mixture onto prepared sheets to cool. 10) In a microwave safe bowl, combine chocolate and shortening. 11) Microwave 90 seconds, stirring once, until melted. 12) Drizzle over popcorn mixture. 13) Let cool before serving.
conv_answer: Take some cookie sheets and grease them.

 Context: Ingredients: 1 tablespoon vegetable oil, 1 onion, chopped, 1 (10 ounce) package frozen chopped spinach, thawed and drained, 5 eggs, beaten, 3 cups shredded Muenster cheese, 1/4 teaspoon salt, 1/8 teaspoon ground black pepper, 
Directions: 0) Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). 1) Lightly grease a 9 inch pie pan. 2) Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. 3) Add onions and cook, stirring occasionally, until onions are soft. 4) Stir in spinach and continue cooking until excess moisture has evaporated. 5) In a large bowl, combine eggs, cheese, salt and pepper. 6) Add spinach mixture and stir to blend. 7) Scoop into prepared pie pan. 8) Bake in preheated oven until eggs have set, about 30 minutes. 9) Let cool for 10 minutes before serving.

Question: Yes, I am ready to start! What is the first step? 
 Context: Ingredients: 1 1/2 cups dried black-eyed peas, soaked overnight, 1/3 cup chopped celery, with leaves, 1 1/2 cups shredded carrot, 3/4 cup chopped fresh parsley, 1/2 cup chopped white onion, 1/8 cup chopped fresh mint, 1/4 cup olive oil, 2 oranges, juiced, 1/2 lemon, juiced, 1 garlic clove, pressed, 1/2 teaspoon ground coriander, 1/2 teaspoon salt, 1/8 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper, 1 teaspoon brown sugar, 
Directions: 0) Place the beans in a saucepan with enough water to cover them by one inch. 1) Bring beans to a slow boil. 2) Reduce heat to low, and simmer until tender but not mushy (about 35 minutes). 3) Set aside to cool. 4) When the beans have cooled, place them in a large bowl. 5) Add the celery, carrots, parsley, white onion, and mint; toss to blend. 6) For dressing, blend olive oil, orange and lemon juice, garlic, coriander, salt, pepper, and brown sugar in a blender for 6 seconds. 7) Transfer to a small saucepan, and simmer over low heat for five minutes. 8) Remove from heat, and cool. 9) Pour dressing over the bean salad, and refrigerate for at least 1 hour before serving.
conv_answer: First place the beans in a saucepan with enough water to cover them by one inch.

Question: Ok easy I have all of them ready. Can we start baking now? 
 Context: Ingredients: 2 1/2 cups all-purpose flour, 1/2 cup sugar, 1/2 cup packed brown sugar, 3 teaspoons baking powder, 1 teaspoon salt, 2 (4 ounce) jars apricot baby food, divided, 1 egg, 3/4 cup milk, 3 tablespoons vegetable oil, 1 teaspoon almond extract, 2/3 cup sliced almonds, coarsely chopped, 1/2 cup diced dried apricots, 1/2 cup confectioners' sugar, 1 teaspoon milk, 1/8 teaspoon almond extract, 
Directions: 0) In a large bowl, combine the flour, sugars, baking powder and salt. 1) Set aside 1 tablespoon baby food for glaze. 2) In another bowl, beat the egg, milk, oil, extract and remaining baby food. 3) Stir into dry ingredients just until moistened. 4) Fold in almonds and apricots. 5) Pour into a greased 9-in loaf pan. 6) Bake at 350 degrees F (180 degrees C) for 55-65 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean. 7) Cool for 10 minutes before removing from the pan to a wire rack. 8) For glaze, combine the confectioners' sugar, milk, extract and reserved baby food until smooth. 9) Drizzle over cooled bread.
conv_answer: We can start with preparing the dough! In a large bowl, combine the flour, sugars, baking powder and salt.
target_answer: 0) In a large bowl, combine the flour, sugars, baking powder and salt.

Directions: 0) In a large bowl, combine the flour, sugars, baking powder and salt. 1) Set aside 1 tablespoon baby food for glaze. 2) In another bowl, beat the egg, milk, oil, extract and remaining baby food. 3) Stir into dry ingredients just until moistened. 4) Fold in almonds and apricots. 5) Pour into a greased 9-in loaf pan. 6) Bake at 350 degrees F (180 degrees C) for 55-65 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean. 7) Cool for 10 minutes before removing from the pan to a wire rack. 8) For glaze, combine the confectioners' sugar, milk, extract and reserved baby food until smooth. 9) Drizzle over cooled bread.
conv_answer: Bravo! Now fold in the almonds and the apricots.
target_answer: 4) Fold in almonds and apricots.

 Context: Ingredients: 1 (2 to 3 pound) whole chicken, cut into pieces, 1 tablespoon olive oil, 2 onions, chopped, 3 cloves garlic, crushed, 1/2 green bell pepper, chopped, 1/2 (15 ounce) can tomato sauce, 1 pinch saffron, salt to taste, 2 cubes  chicken bouillon, 1 1/2 cups uncooked white rice, 1 cup beer, 1 (15 ounce) can peas, drained, 1/2 red bell pepper, roasted and sliced, 
Directions: 0) Heat oil in a large skillet over medium high heat. 1) Saute chicken until lightly browned; remove from skillet and set aside. 2) Saute onion, garlic and green bell pepper until soft; stir in tomato sauce, saffron, salt and bouillon and return chicken pieces to skillet. 3) Cook for 10 minutes, then add rice and reduce heat to low. 4) Add beer and simmer for 8 to 10 minutes, stirring occasionally, until rice is tender. 5) Finally, stir in peas with liquid and garnish with roasted red bell pepper.

Question: Ok no problem. I hope so. What should I do now? 
 Context: Ingredients: 1 pound chicken parts, 1 large onion, 3 stalks celery, including some leaves, 1 large carrot, 1 1/2 teaspoons salt, 3 whole cloves, 6 cups water, 1/4 cup cold water (optional), 1 egg, 
Directions: 0) Quarter onion. 1) Chop scrubbed celery and carrot into 1 inch chunks. 2) Place chicken pieces, onion, celery, carrot, salt, and cloves in large soup pot or Dutch oven. 3) Add 6 cups water. 4) Bring to a boil. 5) Reduce heat, cover, and simmer for 1 hour. 6) Remove chicken and vegetables. 7) Strain stock. 8) Skim fat off the surface. 9) Separate the egg white from the egg yolk, and reserve the shell. 10) In a small bowl, combine 1/4 cup cold water, egg white, and crushed eggshell. 11) Add to strained stock, and bring to a boil. 12) Remove from heat, and let stand 5 minutes. 13) Strain again through a sieve lined with cheesecloth.
conv_answer: Good! We can start with the cooking! First, the onion needs to be quatered. You also need to chop scrubbed celery and carrot into 1 inch chunks.
